property.name: description
property.value: The endpoint URL of this sos which will be shown in the GetCapabilities response (e.g. http://localhost:8080/52nSOS/sos or http://localhost:8080/52nSOS/service). The path to a specific binding (like /soap) will appended to this URL. For detailed information, please read the documentation

property.name: title
property.value: Should this SOS support strict Spatial Filtering Profile?

property.name: description
property.value: Whether the SOS should support strict SOS 2.0 Spatial Filtering Profile. That means each observation should contain a om:parameter with sampling geometry. Else the SOS allows observations without om:parameter with sampling geometry!

property.name: title
property.value: Add outputs to DescribeSensor SensorML responses

property.name: description
property.value: Whether to query example observations and dynamically add outputs to DescribeSensor SensorML responses.

property.name: description
property.value: The path to a directory with the sensor descriptions in SensorML format. It can be either an absolute path (like /home/user/sosconfig/sensors) or a path relative to the web application classes directory (e.g. WEB-INF/classes/sensors).

property.name: title
property.value: Use default prefixes for offering, procedure, features

property.name: description
property.value: Use default prefixes for offering, procedure, features.

property.name: description
property.value: Should the service deregister all used JDBC driver (SQLite, PostgreSQL or H2) during shutdown process.

property.name: description
property.value: The time in seconds, for which writing of an updated cache is delayed. Incremental cache updates that are executed during transactional operations are not immediately persistet, but are delayed to reduce write operations and to improve performance. The delay is the maximum time the persisted and in memory cache can diverge.

property.name: title
property.value: Should this SOS validate the XML response in non debug mode?

property.name: description
property.value: Whether the SOS should validate the XML response when the debug mode is disables!

property.name: description
property.value: Should GetObservation requests without any restriction be blocked

property.name: title
property.value: Encode full for child procedure SensorML in parent DescribeSensor responses

property.name: description
property.value: Whether to encode full SensorML for each child procedures in a DescribeSensor response for a parent procedure.

property.name: description
property.value: The number of threads used to fill the capabilities cache.

property.name: description
property.value: The update interval of the content cache in minutes. Set this to lower value if your database is externally modified frequently. Set to 0 to disable scheduled cache updates.

property.name: title
property.value: Should the SOS return human readable identifier for featureOfInterest?

property.name: description
property.value: Should the SOS return human readable identifier for featureOfInterest (gml:name as gml:identifier)?

property.name: title
property.value: Should the SOS return human readable identifier for offering?

property.name: description
property.value: Should the SOS return human readable identifier for offering (gml:name as gml:identifier)?

property.name: title
property.value: Should the SOS return human readable identifier for observableProperty?

property.name: description
property.value: Should the SOS return human readable identifier for observableProperty (gml:name as gml:identifier)?

property.name: title
property.value: Should the SOS return human readable identifier for procedure?

property.name: description
property.value: Should the SOS return human readable identifier for procedure (gml:name as gml:identifier)?

property.name: title
property.value: Should the SOS return human readable identifier?

property.name: description
property.value: Should the SOS return human readable identifier (gml:name as gml:identifier)?

property.name: description
property.value: Simple security settings to restrict access to transactional methods (InsertSensor, InsertObservation, etc.). Users requiring more control over security should use 52°North WSS.

property.name: description
property.value: Activate/Deactivate transactional security support. If true, allowed IPs or token should be defined! If allowed IPs and/or authorization token are defined, then incoming transactional requests are checked against them.

property.name: description
property.value: Comma separated ranges of IPs that should be allowed to make transactional requests. Use CIDR notation or raw IP addresses (e.g. 127.0.0.1,192.168.0.0/16). Subnet notation is also supported (e.g. 192.168.0.0/255.255.0.0). Leading zeros are not allowed.

property.name: description
property.value: Comma seperated list of allowed proxy IP addresses. These will be used to authorize allowed transactional IP addresses behind proxy servers.

property.name: description
property.value: Authorization token to require for transactional requests. Specified in the HTTP Authorization header (Authorization: {token}).

property.name: description
property.value: Set the I18N default language for this service

property.name: description
property.value: Show all language specific values if no language is queried or the queried language is not supported!

property.name: description
property.value: The EPSG code in which the geometries are stored.

property.name: description
property.value: The underlying datasource supports spatial queries and geometry data types. If not, the SOS only supports Get... operations and only BBOX spatial filtering.

property.name: description
property.value: A list of all EPSG codes with northing first coordinate axis order. The SOS transforms the axis order if the underlying datasource uses a differnent orderfor example from lat/lon to lon/lat, or from x/y to y/x.

property.name: description
property.value: The default 3D EPSG code in which the geometries are returned.

property.name: description
property.value: Set the supported crs for this service as ',' separated list! If empty, this tool supported CRS are used!

property.name: title
property.value: Are the geometries stored in datasource with northing first

property.name: description
property.value: Indicates if the geometries stored in the datasource with northing first axis order

property.name: description
property.value: The default EPSG code in which the geometries are returned.

property.name: description
property.value: The 3D EPSG code in which the geometries are stored.

property.name: description
property.value: Set the CRS authority for this service, e.g. EPSG!

property.name: title
property.value: Should this service stream datasource values (currently only GetObservation) to encoder?

property.name: description
property.value: Whether the service should stream datasource values (currently only GetObservation) to encoder if it is supported by the datasource! This reduces the memory usage.

property.name: title
property.value: Should this service query the streaming datasource values (currently only GetObservation) as chunk of x (true) ora as scrollable values?

property.name: description
property.value: Whether the service should query the streaming stream datasource values (currently only GetObservation) as chunk of x (true) or as scrollable values.

property.name: description
property.value: Number of chunk size, only relevant if scrollable datasource streaming is set to 'true'. If define a number <= 0, the whole values are queried at once!

property.name: title
property.value: Should this service stream the XML responses?

property.name: description
property.value: Whether the service should stream the XML response! If true, the responses are not validated!

property.name: description
property.value: Setting to define AQD e-Reporting related settings.

property.name: description
property.value: AQD e-Reporting observation prefix used for observation gml:id, e.g. 'OBS.' for AQD e-Reporting

property.name: description
property.value: This prefix is used to add a prefix to the Sampling Point identifier, e.g 'SPO.' for AQD e-Reporting

property.name: description
property.value: This prefix is used to add a prefix to the offering identifier

property.name: description
property.value: This prefix is used to add a prefix to the AQD e-Reporting Sample/FeatureOfInterest identifier, e.g. 'SAM.' for AQD e-Reporting

property.name: description
property.value: AQD e-Reporting namespace is used as global prefix for localId of inspireIds. Should end with '/' (http) or ':' (urn)

property.name: description
property.value: This prefix is used to add a prefix to the Station identifier, e.g. 'STA.' for AQD e-Reporting

property.name: title
property.value: Validity flag for validated data (E1 flows)

property.name: description
property.value: Comma separated list of validity flags (int) that indentify validated data. Conjunction (AND) with verification flags!

property.name: title
property.value: Verification flag for validated data (E1 flows)

property.name: description
property.value: Comma separated list of verificatio flags (int) that indentify validated data. Conjunction (AND) with validity flags!

property.name: title
property.value: AQD e-Reporting Sampling Point Process/Procedure prefix

property.name: description
property.value: This prefix is used to add a prefix to the AQD e-Reporting Sampling Point Process/Procedure identifier, 'SPP.' for AQD e-Reporting

property.name: description
property.value: This prefix is used to add a prefix to the Network identifier, e.g. 'NET.' for AQD e-Reporting

property.name: description
property.value: Settings to configure the procedure description generation and enrichment feature.

property.name: description
property.value: The value that will be used for all procedures/sensors of this SOS instance as term for the classifier 'intendedApllication' if the classification generation is activated. In addition, if this field is empty, the classifier 'intendedApplication' will not be added.

property.name: description
property.value: The template used to generate a description using the sensor identifier and the observed properties related. The template MUST contain '%s' three times. The first one will be replaced with 'sensor system' or 'procedure' depending if it's spatial or non-spatial. The second one will be replaced with the sensor id and the third with a comma separated list of properties: e.g. The %s with the id '%s' observes the following properties: '%s'..

property.name: defaultValue
property.value: The '%s' with the id '%s' observes the following properties: '%s'.

property.name: description
property.value: If selected, the service enriches each procedure description with discovery relevant information according to OGC#09-033 'SensorML Profile for Discovery'.

property.name: description
property.value: If selected, the service enriches each procedure description with available observed feature information: listing all features observed by this procedure, for example. If disabled, the returned description of an DescribeSensor response might differ from the document used during the related InsertSensor call.

property.name: description
property.value: The definition for the sml:identification holding the 'longname'. Used only if the procedure description is enriched according to OGC#09-033.

property.name: description
property.value: The definition for the sml:identification holding the 'shortname'. Used only if the sensor description is enriched according to OGC#09-033.

property.name: description
property.value: The definition that will be used for all procedures/sensors of this SOS instance as definition for the classifier 'intendedApllication' if the classification generation is activated.

property.name: description
property.value: The value that will be used for all procedures of this SOS instance as term for the classifier 'procedureType' if the classification generation is activated. In addition, if this field is empty, the classifier 'procedureType' will not be added.

property.name: title
property.value: Description Template for the rules definition

property.name: description
property.value: The template used to generate a description using the procedure identifier and the observed properties. The template MUST contain '%s' two times. The first one will be replaced with the sensor id and the second with a comma separated list of properties: e.g. The procedure '%s' generates the following output(s): '%s'. The input(s) is/are unknown (this description is generated).

property.name: defaultValue
property.value: The procedure '%s' generates the following output(s): '%s'. The input(s) is/are unknown (this description is generated).

property.name: title
property.value: Use service contact as procedure contact

property.name: description
property.value: Should the service contact be encoded as procedure contact if procedure description enrichment is activated.

property.name: description
property.value: If selected, the service enriches each procedure description with available offering information: listing all procedure related offering ids, for example. If disabled, the returned description of an DescribeSensor response might differ from the document used during the related InsertSensor call.

property.name: description
property.value: Should the classifiers for 'intendedApplication' and/or 'sensorType' be generated using the values from the next two settings?

property.name: description
property.value: The UOM for the altitude value of spatial procedures (e.g. sml:System). Something like 'm'.

property.name: description
property.value: The UOM for the latitude & longitude values of spatial procedures (e.g. sml:System). Something like 'degree', 'm'.

property.name: description
property.value: The definition that will be used for all procedures/sensors of this SOS instance as definition for the classifier 'procedureType' if the classification generation is activated.

property.name: description
property.value: EXI is a very compact representation for the XML Information Set that is intended to simultaneously optimize performance and the utilization of computational resources. EXI encoding is available via content type application/exi.

property.name: description
property.value:
Should the EXI encoder preserve comments and the decoder expect comments.
Note: Requires fidelity specific.

property.name: description
property.value:
Should the EXI encoder preserve processing instructions and the decoder expect them.
Note: Requires fidelity specific.

property.name: description
property.value:
Should the EXI encoder preserve DTDs and the decoder expect them.
Note: Requires fidelity specific.

property.name: description
property.value:
Fidelity options allow to preserve some features that might be removed by EXI because of better performance and compression.
  • Default: uses some default options. If any of the other options is selected, default options is skipped.
  • Specific: uses the options activatedfurther down.
  • Strict: no namespace prefixes, comments etc are preserved nor schema deviations are allowed.

property.name: description
property.value:
Grammar options define if the en/decoder use any grammar while processing XML streams.
  • Schema based on XSD: schema information will be used while processing the EXI body (best results (compression)). Available schema can be selected further down.
  • schemaless: no schema information will be used to process the EXI stream (worst results (compression)).
  • XSD Base Types: No user defined schema information is generated for processing the EXI body; however, the built-in XML schema types are available for use in the EXI body.

property.name: description
property.value:
The alignment option is used to control the alignment of event codes and content items.
  • Bit packed: indicates that the event codes and associated content are packed in bits without any padding in-between.
  • Byte packed: indicates that the event codes and associated content are aligned on byte boundaries.
  • Compression: increases compactness using additional computational resources by applying the DEFLATE algorithm.
  • Pre-Compression: indicates that all steps involved in compression are to be done with the exception of the final step of applying the DEFLATE algorithm (the primary use case of pre-compression is to avoid a duplicate compression step when compression capability is built into the transport protocol).

property.name: description
property.value:
Which XSD to use for processing the EXI body.
Note: Requires grammar schema based on XSD.

property.name: description
property.value:
Should the EXI encoder preserve the lexical form of element and attribute values and the decoder expect them.
Note: Requires fidelity specific.

property.name: description
property.value:
Should the EXI encoder preserve prefixes and the decoder expect them.
Note: Requires fidelity specific.

property.name: description
property.value: The path to a file containing an ows:ServiceIdentification overriding the above settings. It can be either an absolute path (like /home/user/sosconfig/identification.xml) or a path relative to the web application directory (e.g. WEB-INF/identification.xml).

entry.value: 52North Sensor Observation Service - Data Access for the Sensor Web

property.name: description
property.value: The character encoding used for responses.

property.name: title
property.value: Maximum number of returned observation values

property.name: description
property.value: Set the maximum number of returned observation values for the Hydrology-Profile. Set to 0 (zero) for unlimited number of observations.

property.name: title
property.value: Maximum number of returned time series

property.name: description
property.value: Set the maximum number of returned time series for the Hydrology-Profile. Set to 0 (zero) for unlimited number of observations.

property.name: description
property.value: The default prefix for features (values from custom db).

property.name: description
property.value: The default prefix for observableProperty (values from custom db).

property.name: title
property.value: Should the SOS return overall extrema?

property.name: description
property.value: Should the SOS return overall extrema for first/latest observation queries or for each time series

property.name: description
property.value: The default prefix for procedures (generated if not defined in Register-/InsertSensor requests or values from custom db).

property.name: description
property.value: Tuple separator in result element (a character)

property.name: description
property.value: The default prefix for offerings (generated if not defined in Register-/InsertSensor requests or values from custom db).

property.name: description
property.value: Prefix for the SRS name in SOS v2.0.0.

property.name: description
property.value: Prefix for the SRS name in SOS v1.0.0.

property.name: description
property.value: Token separator in result element (a character)

property.name: description
property.value: Should OWS ExceptionReports include a complete stack trace for the causing exception?

property.name: title
property.value: Use HTTP Status Codes in KVP and POX Binding?

property.name: description
property.value: Should the response returned by KVP and POX binding use the exception specific HTTP status code or always <tt>HTTP 200 - OK</tt>.

property.name: description
property.value: Decimal separator in result element (a character)

property.name: title
property.value: Should the SOS include value count in GetDataAvailability response?

property.name: description
property.value: Should the SOS include the value count for each timeseries in the GetDataAvailability response?

property.name: description
property.value: Should the SOS show the full or the minimal INSPIRE ExtendedCapabilities

property.name: description
property.value: Should the SOS use the authority prefix (EPSG::) or the OGC CRS prefix (http://www.opengis.net/def/crs/EPSG/0/)?

property.name: description
property.value: Set the INSPIRE extended capabilities Conformity title

property.name: description
property.value: Set the INSPIRE extended capabilities Conformity date of creation

property.name: description
property.value: Set the INSPIRE extended capabilities metadata date

property.name: description
property.value: Indicator to enable/disable the INSPIRE extension

property.name: description
property.value: Set the INSPIRE MetadataUrl URL, required if full INSPIRE ExtendedCapabilities is disabled

property.name: title
property.value: Error Message - No valid KVP parameter

property.name: description
property.value: The bad GET request error message when no valid KVP paramter is found.

property.name: description
property.value: The resource any client is redirected to when accessing the binding endpoint.

property.name: description
property.value: The URL to the encoding schema. Should be a web accessible URL returning a XSD file

property.name: title
property.value: Error Message - HTTP method not allowed for resource

property.name: description
property.value: The error message when the used HTTP method is not allowed for the requested resource type.

property.name: defaultValue
property.value: HTTP method "%s" not allowed for "%s" resources.

property.name: description
property.value: The URL identifier of the RESTful binding.

property.name: description
property.value: The prefix of the RESTful encoding used within XML documents.

property.name: description
property.value: Content type used in the case of not knowing the content type of a externally linked resource.

property.name: title
property.value: Error Message - Bad GET request by id

property.name: description
property.value: The bad GET request by id error message

property.name: description
property.value: The default value fo the URL encoding.

property.name: description
property.value: The start of the bad GET request error message.

property.name: defaultValue
property.value: Received GET request invalid for resource type "%s". Try

property.name: title
property.value: Error Message - Bad GET request global resource

property.name: description
property.value: The bad GET request global resource error message

property.name: description
property.value: Default content type returned by this binding

property.name: description
property.value: The default value of the EPSG code.

property.name: description
property.value: The URI of the RESTful encoding namespace.

property.name: description
property.value: The error message when using the wrong content type in the request body.

property.name: defaultValue
property.value: request with wrong content type received.

property.name: description
property.value: The bad GET request error message when the search request is not valid

property.name: defaultValue
property.value: "../%s?$SEARCH_REQUEST". Please refer to the documentation regarding allowed parameters

property.name: title
property.value: Error Message - not supported content type in accept header

property.name: description
property.value: The content type requested could not be supported.

property.name: defaultValue
property.value: Requested content type as specified in Accept header not supported.

property.name: defaultValue
property.value: is not supported by this service!

property.name: description
property.value: The conformance for the RESTful binding.

property.name: defaultValue
property.value: operation is not allowed for the resource type

property.name: description
property.value: The country of the responsible person.

property.name: description
property.value: The electronic mail address of the responsible person.

property.name: description
property.value: The street address of the responsible person.

property.name: description
property.value: The state of the responsible person.

property.name: description
property.value: The position of the responsible person.

property.value: The postal code of the responsible person.

property.name: description
property.value: The phone number of the responsible person.

property.name: description
property.value: The city of the responsible person.

property.name: description
property.value: The name of the responsible person of this service.

property.name: description
property.value: The path to a file containing an ows:ServiceProvider overriding the above settings. It can be either an absolute path (like /home/user/sosconfig/provider.xml) or a path relative to the web application directory (e.g. WEB-INF/provider.xml).
